intro: Adenia kinabaluensis, commonly known as the Bornean Adenia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Borneo. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its woody stem and compound leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are typically arranged in clusters. It thrives in humid, shaded environments at high altitudes. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
